Sentences_from: Sherlock miał niezwykły dar zwracania dowolnie swoich myśli w jakimbądź kierunku.
Sentences_to: Sherlock Holmes had, in a very remarkable degree, the power of detaching his mind at will.
Translated_sentences: Sherlock had the extraordinary gift of turning his thoughts in any direction.

Sentences_from: Dla tych dwóch powodów nie zeznałem przed sądem wszystkiego, co wiem -- albowiem nie zdałoby się to na nic sędziemu śledczemu -- ale z panem będę zupełnie szczery.
Sentences_to: For both these reasons I thought that I was justified in telling rather less than I knew, since no practical good could result from it, but with you there is no reason why I should not be perfectly frank.
Translated_sentences: For these two reasons, I have not testified in court everything I know -- for it would be of no use to the investigating judge -- but I will be completely honest with you.

Sentences_from: Policya płaci dobrze za wiadomości o zbiegach. Można zarobić kilka funtów.
Sentences_to: "Well, I understand that they get five pounds if they can give information."
Translated_sentences: Policya pays well for news about fugitives. You can earn a few pounds.

Sentences_from: Już Barrymore mówił mi, że nieznajomego obsługuje chłopak.
Sentences_to: It was on his track, and not upon the convict's, that Frankland had stumbled.
Translated_sentences: Barrymore was already telling me that the stranger was served by a boy.

Sentences_from: Gdybyś pani była niewinną, to w pierwszej chwili nie zaprzeczyłabyś, żeś pisała tego dnia do sir Karola.
Sentences_to: If your position is innocent, why did you in the first instance deny having written to Sir Charles upon that date?"
Translated_sentences: If you were innocent, you would not at first deny that you wrote to Sir Charles that day.

Sentences_from: Otworzył nam drzwi stary, mrukliwy służący.
Sentences_to: We were admitted by a strange, wizened, rusty-coated old manservant, who seemed in keeping with the house.
Translated_sentences: An old, gruely servant opened the door for us.

Sentences_from: Wszak macie tu posługacza nazwiskiem Cartridge, który wykazał dużo sprytu podczas śledztwa.
Sentences_to: I have some recollection, Wilson, that you had among your boys a lad named Cartwright, who showed some ability during the investigation."
Translated_sentences: After all, you have a servant named Cartridge here, who showed a lot of cunning during the investigation.

Sentences_from: Oczy jej pałały, nóżka uderzała o ziemię.
Sentences_to: Her eyes blazed at me, and she tapped the ground impatiently with her foot.
Translated_sentences: Her eyes were burning, her leg was hitting the ground.

Sentences_from: -- Czy nie należałoby przedewszystkiem pozbyć się małżonków Barrymore?
Sentences_to: "Would it not be well in the first place to get rid of this Barrymore couple?"
Translated_sentences: Shouldn't we get rid of the Barrymore spouses in the first place?

Sentences_from: Człowiek przedhistoryczny zaludniał gęsto te bagna, a ponieważ od tych czasów nikt tu nie mieszkał, ich jaskinie pozostały nietknięte.
Sentences_to: Prehistoric man lived thickly on the moor, and as no one in particular has lived there since, we find all his little arrangements exactly as he left them. These are his wigwams with the roofs off.
Translated_sentences: Prehistoric man densely populated these swamps, and since no one had lived here since then, their caves remained untouched.

Sentences_from: -- Doniesiono mi z policyi, że ktoś, mieszkający pod tym adresem, wypytuje o Nr. 2704 -- rzekł ów człowiek o twarzy dobrodusznej. -- Jeżdżę już siedem lat i nikt na mnie nigdy skargi nie wnosił, więc bardzo mnie to zadziwiło i przyjechałem, żeby się dowiedzieć, co pan ma przeciwko mnie.
Sentences_to: "I got a message from the head office that a gent at this address had been inquiring for 2704," said he. "I've driven my cab this seven years and never a word of complaint. I came here straight from the Yard to ask you to your face what you had against me."
Translated_sentences: "It was reported to me from the police that someone living at this address was inquiring about No. 2704," said the man with a good-minded face. "I've been driving for seven years now, and no one has ever complained about me, so I was very surprised and I came to find out what you had against me.

Sentences_from: -- Czyżeś pan nie oglądał ziemi dokoła?
Sentences_to: "Good heaven! Did no one examine?"
Translated_sentences: "Have you not seen the earth around?"

Sentences_from: Dziki zwierz biegł śladami naszego przyjaciela w podskokach...
Sentences_to: "Hist!" cried Holmes, and I heard the sharp click of a cocking pistol. "Look out! It's coming!"
Translated_sentences: A wild beast ran in the footsteps of our friend in jumps...

Sentences_from: Wahał się, jak gdyby żałował swego odezwania, lub nie mógł znaleźć słów do wyrażenia myśli.
Sentences_to: Barrymore hesitated for a moment, as if he regretted his outburst, or found it difficult to express his own feelings in words.
Translated_sentences: He hesitated, as if he regretted his speech, or could not find the words to express his thoughts.

Sentences_from: Zbrodniarz zaklął przeraźliwie i zrzucił ogromny kamień. Roztrzaskał się on o skałę, o którą opieraliśmy się przed chwilą.
Sentences_to: At the same moment the convict screamed out a curse at us and hurled a rock which splintered up against the boulder which had sheltered us.
Translated_sentences: The criminal cursed tremendously and threw down a huge stone. It crashed into the rock we had just leaned against.

Sentences_from: Ma obecnie siedem procesów, które zapewne pochłoną resztę jego fortuny. Po za tą manią wydaje się dobrodusznym, poczciwym staruszkiem; wspominam o nim dlatego tylko, żeś mi polecił opisywać ci wszystkie osoby, które spotykam i o których słyszę.
Sentences_to: He is said to have about seven lawsuits upon his hands at present, which will probably swallow up the remainder of his fortune and so draw his sting and leave him harmless for the future. Apart from the law he seems a kindly, good-natured person, and I only mention him because you were particular that I should send some description of the people who surround us.
Translated_sentences: He currently has seven trials that will probably consume the rest of his fortune. Behind this mania, he seems to be a good-natured, good old man; I mention him only because you have instructed me to describe to you all the people I meet and hear about.

Sentences_from: -- Spostrzegłem to odrazu, gdyś pan wszedł do pokoju -- odparł Holmes.
Sentences_to: "I observed it as you entered the room," said Holmes.
Translated_sentences: "I saw this at once, when you entered the room," replied Holmes.

Sentences_from: -- Jak widzę, pamiętasz, Wilson, drobną przysługę, którą miałem sposobność ci wyświadczyć -- rzekł mój przyjaciel.
Sentences_to: "Ah, Wilson, I see you have not forgotten the little case in which I had the good fortune to help you?"
Translated_sentences: "As I see, you remember, Wilson, a small favor that I had the opportunity to do to you," said my friend.

Sentences_from: Odwróciłem się, pewien, że ujrzę doktora Mortimer, lecz ku mojemu zdziwieniu, zobaczyłem nieznajomego. Był to mężczyzna niewielkiego wzrostu, o twarzy wygolonej, o włosach ciemnych, gładko przyczesanych; mógł mieć lat trzydzieści parę do czterdziestu.
Sentences_to: "Your net and box would have told me as much," said I, "for I knew that Mr. Stapleton was a naturalist.
Translated_sentences: I turned around, sure to see Dr. Mortimer, but to my surprise, I saw a stranger. He was a man of small stature, with a shaved face, with dark hair, smoothly combed; he could have been thirty-something to forty.

Sentences_from: Minęliśmy ciemną aleję, i szerokim, wzniesionym podjazdem zajechaliśmy przed pałac. Środkowy korpus ozdobiony był wspaniałym portykiem; po bokach wznosiły się wieże, średniowieczne, zębate, ze strzelnicami.
Sentences_to: The avenue opened into a broad expanse of turf, and the house lay before us. In the fading light I could see that the centre was a heavy block of building from which a porch projected. The whole front was draped in ivy, with a patch clipped bare here and there where a window or a coat-of-arms broke through the dark veil. >From this central block rose the twin towers, ancient, crenelated, and pierced with many loopholes. To right and left of the turrets were more modern wings of black granite. A dull light shone through heavy mullioned windows, and from the high chimneys which rose from the steep, high-angled roof there sprang a single black column of smoke.
Translated_sentences: We passed a dark avenue, and on a wide, erect driveway we drove in front of the palace. The central body was decorated with a magnificent portich; on the sides there were towers, medieval, toothed, with arrowslits.

Sentences_from: Jak wielu mądrych zbrodniarzy, jest zapewne zbyt zaufany w swoim rozumie i wyobraża sobie, że nas w pole wywiedzie.
Sentences_to: Like most clever criminals, he may be too confident in his own cleverness and imagine that he has completely deceived us."
Translated_sentences: Like many wise criminals, he is probably too trusted in his understanding and imagines that he will bring us into the field.

Sentences_from: Sir Henryk i doktor Mortimer bawili w Londynie, gotując się do dalekiej podróży, która miała wzmocnić nerwy baroneta.
Sentences_to: Sir Henry and Dr. Mortimer were, however, in London, on their way to that long voyage which had been recommended for the restoration of his shattered nerves. They had called upon us that very afternoon, so that it was natural that the subject should come up for discussion.
Translated_sentences: Sir Henry and Dr. Mortimer were entertaining in London, preparing for a long journey that would strengthen the baronet's nerves.

Sentences_from: Dom, przerobiony widocznie ze starej fermy, wznosił się wśród drzew niewielkich, otoczony był murowanym parkanom; wyglądał smutno i ponuro.
Sentences_to: An orchard surrounded it, but the trees, as is usual upon the moor, were stunted and nipped, and the effect of the whole place was mean and melancholy.
Translated_sentences: The house, apparently converted from an old farm, rose among small trees, was surrounded by brick fences; he looked sad and gloomy.

Sentences_from: -- Ha! nie jest to miła robota, zwłaszcza wśród takiego otoczenia. Cóż za pustkowie!... -- mówił Lestrade, oglądając się dokoła.
Sentences_to: "My word, it does not seem a very cheerful place," said the detective with a shiver, glancing round him at the gloomy slopes of the hill and at the huge lake of fog which lay over the Grimpen Mire. "I see the lights of a house ahead of us."
Translated_sentences: -- Ha! it's not a nice job, especially in such an environment. What a wasteland!... -- Lestrade said as he looked around.

Sentences_from: Oto i wszystko, co wiem o tej ciekawej sprawie.
Sentences_to: "No doubt. There only remains one difficulty.
Translated_sentences: Here's everything I know about this interesting case.

Sentences_from: Czy wolno mi zapytać, kto jest pierwszym?
Sentences_to: May I inquire who has the honour to be the first?" asked Holmes with some asperity.
Translated_sentences: Am I allowed to ask who is the first?

Sentences_from: -- A więc poproszę pana, abyś słuchał mnie ślepo.
Sentences_to: "Very good; and I will ask you also to do it blindly, without always asking the reason."
Translated_sentences: "So I will ask you to listen to me blindly.

Sentences_from: -- Ho, ho! mój chłopcze, źle się domyślasz. Słyszałeś zapewne o zbiegu, ukrywającym się na bagnie?
Sentences_to: "Ha, ha, my boy, a very much more important matter than that!
Translated_sentences: "Ho, ho! my boy, you guess wrong. Have you heard of a fugitive hiding in a swamp?

Sentences_from: -- Cóż mogę panu o nim powiedzieć? -- rzekła, bawiąc się łańcuszkiem od zegarka.
Sentences_to: "What can I tell you about him?" she asked, and her fingers played nervously over the stops of her typewriter.
Translated_sentences: "What can I tell you about him?" "She said, playing with the watch chain.

Sentences_from: Na prośby sir Henryka, doktor zaprowadził nas wszystkich do Alei Wiązów, aby nam pokazać, jak się rzeczy miały owej nocy.
Sentences_to: He has been excavating a barrow at Long Down, and has got a prehistoric skull which fills him with great joy. Never was there such a single-minded enthusiast as he!
Translated_sentences: At Sir Henry's request, the Doctor led us all to The Alley of The Eims to show us how things were going that night.

Sentences_from: Cartwright”. -- A więc obie moje nici zerwane -- rzekł Holmes. -- Nic mnie tak nie podnieca, jak niepowodzenie.
Sentences_to: "There go two of my threads, Watson. There is nothing more stimulating than a case where everything goes against you.
Translated_sentences: Cartwright". "So both of my threads are broken," said Holmes. Nothing excites me as much as failure.

Sentences_from: -- Jego celem jest... morderstwo -- chłodne, wyrafinowane -- odparł. -- Nie pytaj mnie o szczegóły.
Sentences_to: "It is murder, Watson--refined, cold-blooded, deliberate murder. Do not ask me for particulars.
Translated_sentences: "His goal is... murder -- cool, sophisticated -- he replied. Don't ask me for details.

Sentences_from: Dziękuję. A chciałbym też zmienić pięciofuntowy banknot.
Sentences_to: And I should be glad to have change of this five-pound note."

Sentences_from: Gdybyśmy go oszczędzili, mogliby to przypłacić życiem sąsiedzi, Stapletonowie naprzykład.
Sentences_to: With his brutal and violent nature, others would have to pay the price if we held our hands.
Translated_sentences: If we had spared him, his neighbors, the Stapletons, for example, could have paid for his lives.

Sentences_from: -- Tak, panie -- mówiła jakby w odpowiedzi na nasze myśli. -- Moje panieńskie nazwisko było Seldon, a to mój brat młodszy... Psuliśmy go za jego lat dziecinnych, wszystko mu było wolno, więc nabrał przekonania, że świat istnieje dla jego przyjemności...
Sentences_to: "Yes, sir, my name was Selden, and he is my younger brother. We humoured him too much when he was a lad, and gave him his own way in everything until he came to think that the world was made for his pleasure, and that he could do what he liked in it.
Translated_sentences: "Yes, sir," she said as if in response to our thoughts. "My maiden name was Seldon, and that's my younger brother... We spoiled him during his childish years, everything was allowed to him, so he became convinced that the world existed for his pleasure...

Sentences_from: -- To prawda -- przytwierdził Barrymore. -- Mówiłem, że tajemnica nie moja i że nie mam prawa jej zdradzić.
Sentences_to: "That's the truth, sir," said Barrymore. "I said that it was not my secret and that I could not tell it to you.

Sentences_from: Niedowiarstwo mogło jedynie skłonić Franklanda do udzielenia mi bliższych informacyj.
Sentences_to: "I should say that it was much more likely that it was the son of one of the moorland shepherds taking out his father's dinner."
Translated_sentences: Indeutitude could only lead Frankland to give me closer information.

Sentences_from: -- Ponieważ Roger Baskerville, młodszy brat sir Karola, zmarł bezżennie i bezpotomnie, zatem majątek przeszedłby na dalekich krewnych, Desmondów.
Sentences_to: "Since Rodger Baskerville, Sir Charles's younger brother died unmarried, the estate would descend to the Desmonds, who are distant cousins.
Translated_sentences: "Since Roger Baskerville, sir Charles' younger brother, died unmarried and childless, the estate would have passed to distant relatives, the Desmonds.

Sentences_from: Niecierpliwiło mnie to często, ale nigdy do tego stopnia, jak owego wieczora. Czekało nas zadanie trudne i niebezpieczne, mieliśmy działać wspólnie, a jednak Holmes nie wyznaczał nam roli.
Sentences_to: Our conversation was hampered by the presence of the driver of the hired wagonette, so that we were forced to talk of trivial matters when our nerves were tense with emotion and anticipation.
Translated_sentences: I was impatient often, but never to the extent that night. A difficult and dangerous task awaited us, we were to act together, and yet Holmes did not assign us a role.

Sentences_from: W połowie drogi jest furtka, prowadząca na łąkę, za którą leży trzęsawisko.
Sentences_to: At the far end is an old tumble-down summer-house. Half-way down is the moor-gate, where the old gentleman left his cigar-ash.
Translated_sentences: Halfway there is a gate leading to the meadow, behind which lies a bog.

Sentences_from: Były to jedyne oznaki życia; dokoła pustka i cisza, nigdzie nie mogłem dojrzeć śladów owej postaci widmowej, którą dostrzegłem parę dni temu.
Sentences_to: They were the only signs of human life which I could see, save only those prehistoric huts which lay thickly upon the slopes of the hills. Nowhere was there any trace of that lonely man whom I had seen on the same spot two nights before.
Translated_sentences: These were the only signs of life; There was emptiness and silence all around, nowhere could I see the traces of that phantom figure that I had seen a few days ago.

Sentences_from: Powiedział odrazu, że jest detektywem i ofiarował mi dwie gwinee, jeżeli przez cały dzień będę spełniał jego rozkazy i o nic pytać nie będę.
Sentences_to: He said that he was a detective, and he offered me two guineas if I would do exactly what he wanted all day and ask no questions.
Translated_sentences: He said at once that he was a detective and offered me two guineas if I followed his orders all day and didn't ask anything.

Sentences_from: Doktor Mortimer pytał o powód moich indagacyj; zaspokoiłem jego ciekawość, nie mówiąc mu prawdy: po co tyle osób ma wiedzieć o tym liście?
Sentences_to: He wanted to know the object of my inquiries, but I managed to satisfy his curiosity without telling him too much, for there is no reason why we should take anyone into our confidence.
Translated_sentences: Dr. Mortimer asked about the reason for my indagacyj; I satisfied his curiosity without telling him the truth: why should so many people know about this letter?

Sentences_from: Nie, on poprostu biegł, _uciekał_, aż wreszcie padł twarzą na ziemię.

Sentences_from: Obaj wyciągnęliśmy ręce zziębnięte, a rozgrzawszy się, wodziliśmy oczyma po ścianach, zawieszonych zbrojami, strzelbami i myśliwskimi trofeami.
Sentences_to: Then we gazed round us at the high, thin window of old stained glass, the oak panelling, the stags' heads, the coats-of-arms upon the walls, all dim and sombre in the subdued light of the central lamp.
Translated_sentences: We both stretched out our hands cold, and warming up, we ran our eyes across the walls, suspended with armor, shotguns and hunting trophies.

Sentences_from: Doktor Mortimer jest człowiekiem uczonym w swoim zakresie, biedny sir Karol był miłym towarzyszem.
Sentences_to: Dr. Mortimer is a most learned man in his own line. Poor Sir Charles was also an admirable companion.

Sentences_from: Tok moich myśli został przerwany odgłosem kroków.
Sentences_to: You may possibly have heard my name from our mutual friend, Mortimer.
Translated_sentences: The train of my thoughts was interrupted by the sound of footsteps.

Sentences_from: Czyż podobna, aby osoba tak przyzwoita i poważna miała w swoich żyłach tę samą krew, co słynny zbrodniarz?...
Sentences_to: Was it possible that this stolidly respectable person was of the same blood as one of the most notorious criminals in the country?
Translated_sentences: Is it similar that a person so decent and serious has the same blood in his veins as the famous criminal?...

Sentences_from: -- I pomyśleć, że słyszeliśmy jego jęki i nie mogliśmy nadbiedz mu z pomocą....
Sentences_to: "That we should have heard his screams--my God, those screams!--and yet have been unable to save him!
Translated_sentences: "And to think that we heard his mooing and couldn't help him."

Sentences_from: To światło jest sygnałem, że przygotowaliśmy dla niego pożywienie... a tamto światełko wskazuje, gdzie mamy je przynieść...

Sentences_from: Ale dziewczyna, będąc skromną, i bogobojną, obawiała się go, jak szatana.

Sentences_from: A zatem do tego miejsca doszedł bezpiecznie.

Sentences_from: Na ciele nie było żadnych obrażeń.

Sentences_from: To rzęrzenie było jego ostatnim oddechem.

Sentences_from: -- Istotnie, Watson, przechodzisz sam siebie -- rzekł Holmes, zapalając papierosa. -- Muszę przyznać, że pańskie wnioski są słuszne.
Sentences_to: "Really, Watson, you excel yourself," said Holmes, pushing back his chair and lighting a cigarette. "I am bound to say that in all the accounts which you have been so good as to give of my own small achievements you have habitually underrated your own abilities.
Translated_sentences: "Indeed, Watson, you are passing by yourself," said Holmes, lighting a cigarette. -- I must admit that your conclusions are correct.

Sentences_from: -- Twoja rozmowa z tą damę rzuciła właśnie światło na ten punkt ciemny.
Sentences_to: "That is one of the points upon which your own researches have shed a light. Your interview with the lady has cleared the situation very much.
Translated_sentences: "Your conversation with this lady has just shed light on this dark point.

Sentences_from: Baskerville przyglądał mu się ze wzruszeniem, jako pobojowisku, na którem rozegrywały się tragiczne losy jego rodziny.
Sentences_to: There he sat, with his tweed suit and his American accent, in the corner of a prosaic railway-carriage, and yet as I looked at his dark and expressive face I felt more than ever how true a descendant he was of that long line of high-blooded, fiery, and masterful men. There were pride, valour, and strength in his thick brows, his sensitive nostrils, and his large hazel eyes.
Translated_sentences: Baskerville watched him with emotion as a battlefield where the tragic fate of his family was played.

Sentences_from: Oprócz p. Frankland w Lafterhall i naturalisty, p. Stapleton, w pobliżu niema ludzi inteligentnych.
Sentences_to: With the exception of Mr. Frankland, of Lafter Hall, and Mr. Stapleton, the naturalist, there are no other men of education within many miles.
Translated_sentences: In addition to Mr. Frankland in Lafterhall and the naturalist, Mr. Stapleton, there are no intelligent people nearby.

Sentences_from: Zaopatrzyliśmy go we wszystko, czego potrzebował, a następnie, przy sutej wieczerzy, opowiedzieliśmy baronetowi naszą przygodę, z opuszczeniem pewnych szczegółów.
Sentences_to: Between us we soon supplied his wants, and then over a belated supper we explained to the baronet as much of our experience as it seemed desirable that he should know.
Translated_sentences: We provided him with everything he needed, and then, at a sumptuous supper, we told the baronet our adventure, with the omission of certain details.

Sentences_from: -- Mam nadzieję, że go schwytam i nałożę mu kaganiec, ale potrzebuję pańskiej pomocy.
Sentences_to: "I think I will muzzle him and chain him all right if you will give me your help."

Sentences_from: -- Zdaje mi się, że ztamtąd -- odparłem, wskazując na lewo.
Sentences_to: "There, I think." I pointed into the darkness.

Sentences_from: -- Doprawdy, panie Holmes, to przechodzi wszelkie pojęcie! -- rzekł doktor Mortimer, patrząc na mego przyjaciela ze zdumieniem. -- Nie dość, że pan poznałeś odrazu, iż słowa zostały wycięte z dziennika, ale domyśliłeś się, z którego.
Sentences_to: "Really, Mr. Holmes, this exceeds anything which I could have imagined," said Dr. Mortimer, gazing at my friend in amazement. "I could understand anyone saying that the words were from a newspaper; but that you should name which, and add that it came from the leading article, is really one of the most remarkable things which I have ever known.
Translated_sentences: "Indeed, Mr Holmes, this is beyond all comprehension! "Said Dr. Mortimer, looking at my friend in amazement. "Not only did you know at once that the words had been cut from the diary, but you guessed from which one.

Sentences_from: Przedewszystkiem postarał się osiąść jaknajbliżej siedziby swych przodków, powtóre -- nawiązać przyjazny stosunek z sir Karolem Baskerville, oraz z jego sąsiadami.
Sentences_to: "The baronet himself told him about the family hound, and so prepared the way for his own death. Stapleton, as I will continue to call him, knew that the old man's heart was weak and that a shock would kill him.
Translated_sentences: Above all, he endeavored to settle as close as possible to the abode of his ancestors, and again -- to establish a friendly relationship with Sir Charles Baskerville and his neighbors.

Sentences_from: Stapleton poznał ją przypadkowo, zainteresował się niby jej losem i wzbudził dla niej współczucie w litościwem sercu baroneta; że zaś potrafił zyskiwać względy kobiet i przedstawił się jako kawaler, wkrótce zdobył nietylko zaufanie, lecz i serce pięknej Laury; dawał jej też do zrozumienia, że się z nią ożeni, jeśli ona rozwiedzie się z mężem.
Sentences_to: He therefore put pressure upon Mrs. Lyons to write this letter, imploring the old man to give her an interview on the evening before his departure for London. He then, by a specious argument, prevented her from going, and so had the chance for which he had waited.
Translated_sentences: Stapleton met her by chance, became interested in her fate, and aroused sympathy for her in the compassionate heart of the baronet; and that he was able to win the favor of women and presented himself as a bachelor, he soon gained not only the trust but also the heart of the beautiful Laura; he also let her know that he would marry her if she divorced her husband.

Sentences_from: Przypomniała mi się dziwna przestroga, wycięta ze wstępnego artykułu _Timesa_.
Sentences_to: Suddenly my thoughts were interrupted by the sound of running feet behind me and by a voice which called me by name.
Translated_sentences: I was reminded of a strange warning, cut from an initial _Times_ article.

Sentences_from: Trzymamy go. Watson! gotów jestem założyć się, że jutro wpadnie w moje sieci, tak, jak motyle, za którymi sam się ugania.
Sentences_to: We have him, Watson, we have him, and I dare swear that before to-morrow night he will be fluttering in our net as helpless as one of his own butterflies. A pin, a cork, and a card, and we add him to the Baker Street collection!"
Translated_sentences: We keep it. Watson! I'm willing to bet that tomorrow he'll fall into my nets, just like the butterflies he chases after himself.

Sentences_from: Nic dziwnego, że mój stryj stał się dziwakiem. Połóżmy się wcześniej.
Sentences_to: I don't wonder that my uncle got a little jumpy if he lived all alone in such a house as this.

Sentences_from: Nie jestem tchórzem, Watson, lecz to szczekanie ścięło mi krew w żyłach.

Sentences_from: _17 października._ Przez cały dzień deszcz padał.

Sentences_from: To są fakty realne, lecz owym nieznajomym może być zarówno przyjaciel, jak i wróg.

Sentences_from: Kilka osób z sąsiedztwa postarało się dostarczyć jej uczciwego zarobku.

Sentences_from: Spacerowałem właśnie z moim przyjacielem, gdy doleciał nas krzyk przeraźliwy.

Sentences_from: Wahałem się między poczuciem delikatności a obowiązku.

It is true that if any sudden danger had threatened him I was too far away to be of use, and yet I am sure that you will agree with me that the position was very difficult, and that there was nothing more which I could do.
Translated_sentences: I vacillacted between a sense of delicacy and duty.

Sentences_from: Widziałem, jak wszedł do pokoju, w którym pozostawił był sir Henryka.

Sentences_from: Ubierzemy się zaraz i przed widowiskiem pojedziemy na obiad do pierwszorzędnej restauracyi. Dobrze?...

Sentences_from: -- Jeszcze jedno pytanie -- rzekłem, wstając. -- Wszak między nami nie powinno być sekretów.

Sentences_from: Mrs. Lyons nie miała wprawdzie pojęcia ani o jednem, ani o drugiem, lecz zastanowiło ją, że śmierć starego gentlemana wynikła o godzinie, wyznaczonej na spotkanie z nią.
Sentences_to: Mrs. Stapleton knew that he had designs upon the old man, and also of the existence of the hound.

Sentences_from: Jeżeli pani nie może przytoczyć mi ważniejszego powodu, to tym argumentem nie zdołam go skłonić do opuszczenia Baskerville-Hall.

Sentences_from: W całej okolicy zapanował strach przesądny. Nikt po nocy nie przejdzie przez łąkę.
Sentences_to: I assure you that there is a reign of terror in the district, and that it is a hardy man who will cross the moor at night."

Sentences_from: Nikczemnik poznał odrazu, jaką może stąd korzyść osiągnąć; obmyślił dla baroneta śmierć niezawodną, za którą nikt nie mógł być pociągnięty do odpowiedzialności.
Sentences_to: "Having conceived the idea he proceeded to carry it out with considerable finesse. An ordinary schemer would have been content to work with a savage hound.

Sentences_from: A jednak sam fakt może się wydać błahym.

Sentences_from: W razie napaści, któż przyjdzie z pomocą?...

Sentences_from: Powiedz mi, jaki on ma w tem cel?

Sentences_from: -- I owszem, Watson zna mój system.

Sentences_from: Ale wpierw czekał mnie przykry obowiązek uwiadomienia Barrymorów o śmierci Seldona.
Sentences_to: But first I had the unpleasant duty of breaking the news to Barrymore and his wife.
